message.content:
cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.NE. 

The paper discusses the design of smart things that are capable of sensing, processing, communicating, and/or actuating without centralized control. This involves modeling the smart things as physical agents with a body composed of a microcontroller, sensors, and actuators, and a brain represented by an artificial neural network. The behavior of these agents is autonomously configured through an evolutionary algorithm. This work involves aspects of multi-agent systems (cs.MA), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), control systems (cs.SY), and neural networks (cs.NE).
